column4: Not to sound frantic, but I accidently did apt-get dbus and it tried to "upgrade" like 40 packages
now if I do apt-get upgrade it's trying to downgrade packages?
how can I undo this package issue :(!
oh, sorry, ok
Okay, I'm pasting
here is the output: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9885
what are you trying to do?
nothing, I want to keep all these packages AS THEY ARE
I did $sudo apt-get install dbus and it freaked out
did you change your sources.list or something?
no, I just did apt-get install dbus
what version of ubuntu are you running.
I'm not sure which I did first
you are running dapper
well did you install breezy or dapper?
maybe not yet.
not when you did yum update.  yum update just hits the repos and gets all the updated packages versions and info etc...
err apt-get update
which directory are you looking for where to put pages?
typically uses /var/www but I would check your config to make sure.
and the config would be in /etc/apache2 something or other.
I'm here every once in a while.
